document.docAuthor: Corona, Emily M. & Brown, Brian V.
document.docTitle: Diplonevra hypermeka Corona & Brown, 2005, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The Central American species of Diplonevra Lioy (Diptera: Phoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Central American species of Diplonevra Lioy (Diptera: Phoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Recognition . This species keys to
D. impressa
(=
D. setigera
herein) in Borgmeier’s ( 1969 ) key, but differs in the setation at the base of the hind femur. In
D. hypermeka
there is a group of setae, including 3 long ones and several shorter (
Fig. 4
), whereas
D. setigera
has 2–3 short setae only (
Figs. 5–11
). In Central America , this species is most like to be confused with
D. truncatiseta ,
whose setae (
Fig. 12
) differ markedly, and whose single reduced seta is easily visible with light microscopy.
Derivation of specific epithet . Derived from Greek hypermekes meaning extremely long, referring to the long setae on the posterior margin of the right side of the epandrium.
